div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

div.p: WELCOME
Today Superintendent Michele Starkey provided an update from Logansport Community Schools on plans to proceed for the remainder of the 19-20 school year. Read more here: https://bit.ly/2xPmHkV
All LCSC elementary schools are currently enrolling for Kindergarten! We can't wait to welcome the Class of 2033 to our campuses. Begin enrollment today: https://bit.ly/2x1WG21

Tomorrow, Monday, April 20, is the last day to order a Very Berry Hero sign. These can be purchased to honor a senior or any LCSC employee. Signs will be delivered to those honored to display in their yard or window. Online ordering is now available here: https://bit.ly/2X5wluz
Kindergarten enrollment is now open. Visit the school website in the district you live and visit the news section to learn more!
Join us today at 12 pm with a live update from Michele Starkey! You can access the live stream here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=20B9keJLF84

div.h6: All Logansport Community Schools will utilize eLearning for the remainder of the 19-20 school year
div.p: On April 2, 2020, the state announced new steps to combat the spread of COVID-19, including mandated closures of all Indiana schools for the remainder of the 19-20 school year. This mandated closure follows recent Centers for Disease Control guidelines to limit gatherings to less than 10. The closure also includes cancellation/postponement of all after school practices, extra-curricular activities, as well as, all school and PTO sponsored events.

All Logansport Community School Corporation students will begin utilizing eLearning. eLearning will take place on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays of each week. On Mondays and Fridays, teachers will be utilizing this time to prep and grade student assignments. Students will have 3 days of eLearning for the remainder of the 19-20 school year. The last student day is Wednesday, May 20.

The LCSC Food Service Team will provide meals to anyone 18 and younger. 5 breakfasts and 5 lunches will be provided at each pickup location. Meal distribution will take place every Tuesday in April (Apr. 7, 14, 21, 28) at the following locations:
Logansport High School and Columbia Elementary School
Pickup Window: 10 am-12 pm

Families are to stay in their vehicles in the meal distribution lines, as food packs will be delivered directly to the vehicle by LCSC staff. If you are unable to attend the meal pickup due to conflicting work hours or no transportation, please contact you students school and we will do our best to accommodate your needs. Felix's Pantry will distribute additional food bags throughout the school closure period. Additional food resources: Emmaus Mission Center and Salvation Army
Commencement for the Class of 2020 has been rescheduled to Sunday, August 2, 2020. You can read more about commencement plans here.
Please check our dedicated COVID-19 information page for additional information and resources.
